etymology.description: pictogram: a bed; original form of 牀; contracted in 臧.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a side view of a bed or wooden frame. Later served as the left-hand element in words for bed (牀/床) and survives in reduced form within 臧.

examples.chinese: 床字左边是爿(床字左邊是爿)。
examples.english: On the left side of the character 床 is 爿.

examples.chinese: 古文字中，爿象床的形状(古文字中，爿象床的形狀)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ wénzì zhōng, qiáng xiàng chuáng de xíngzhuàng.
examples.english: In ancient scripts, 爿 resembles the shape of a bed.

examples.chinese: 臧字里有个简化的爿(臧字裡有個簡化的爿)。
examples.pinyin: Zāng zì lǐ yǒu gè jiǎnhuà de qiáng.
examples.english: Inside the character 臧 there is a contracted form of 爿.
